page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: Ribble Motor Company runs the Ormskirk bus service from it's Skelmersdale depot. The main routes out of the town are to Wigan, South@ort, St. Helens, Liverpool and Skelmersdale. The buses cover over 3000 miles per day. Mersey rail network runs trains to Liverpool and the line to the north of Ormskirk runs to Preston. Both trains and buses are busy on market days and at the rush hours but other than at these times, the services are poorly utilised. The town centre is pedestrianised so that most of the buses and the cars avoid the town centre itself. In the old days, trains used to run to Skelmersdale and St Helens and also directly to Southport but the lines have now been removed. Similarly there were straight through trains to many towns in northern Lancashire.
